---
title: "Idea for baseline summary on top of LS means"
output: html_document
---

```{r setup, include=FALSE}
knitr::opts_chunk$set(echo = TRUE)
```

```{r}
library(dplyr)
library(lme4)
library(tern.mmrm)

dat <- sleepstudy %>%
  mutate(
    group = factor(rep(c("A", "B"), length = nrow(sleepstudy))),
    days_grouped = cut(
      Days,
      breaks = stats::quantile(Days, probs = seq(0, 1, length = 5)),
      include.lowest = TRUE
    ),
    Subject = case_when(
      group == "A" ~ as.character(Subject),
      TRUE ~ as.character(as.numeric(as.character(Subject)) + 50)
    )
  ) %>%
  distinct_at(.vars = c("Subject", "days_grouped", "group"), .keep_all = TRUE)

result <- fit_mmrm(
  vars = list(
    response = "Reaction",
    covariates = c(),
    id = "Subject",
    arm = "group",
    visit = "days_grouped"
  ),
  data = dat,
  cor_struct = "compound-symmetry",
  parallel = TRUE
)

dat_adsl <- dat %>%
  select(Subject, group) %>%
  unique()

# First have the ls means table.
a <- basic_table() %>%
  split_cols_by("group", ref_group = result$ref_level) %>%
  add_colcounts() %>%
  split_rows_by("days_grouped") %>%
  summarize_lsmeans(show_relative = "increase") %>%
  build_table(
    df = broom::tidy(result),
    alt_counts_df = dat_adsl
  )
rtables::table_structure(a)

# second do the baseline table
baseline_dat <- dat %>%
  filter(Days == 0) %>%
  mutate(days_grouped = droplevels(days_grouped))

b <- basic_table() %>%
  split_cols_by("group", ref_group = result$ref_level) %>%
  add_colcounts() %>%
  split_rows_by("days_grouped") %>%
  summarize_vars("Reaction") %>%
  build_table(
    baseline_dat,
    alt_counts_df = dat_adsl
  )
rtables::table_structure(b)
rtables::table_structure(a)

# Now we try to combine them.

head(a)
head(b)

rbind(a, b)

rtables:::col_info(a)
rtables:::col_info(b)
```
